intro: Cyclophorus bonii, commonly known as the Bonii's cyclophorus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves and small, umbel-like flowers. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
